segments.text: This kitchen is a total mess—water everywhere, disgusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink's overflowing like some sloppy plumbing nightmare.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman's standing in the puddle, drying a plate without a care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's soaked, and she doesn't even wipe it off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Kids pilfering cookies from the jar—greedy little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's on that rickety stool, hand deep in the sweets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Crumbly cookies dropping everywhere, what a waste.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's begging for one, adding to the filth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water streaming down the cabinets—it's ruining the wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is clean, but in here it's revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dish towel all bunched and dirty now from the splash.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand the sloppiness of it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Potential slips on that wet floor make it even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
